comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110624 Thunderbird/5.0
Lightning 1.0b5rc1

Alarms/reminders for recurring event throw MODIFICATION_FAILED if calendar color changed.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new Thunderbird profile, install Lightning, restart Thunderbird.
2. Create a new event with daily recurrence and reminder 0 minutes before the event starts.
3. Wait for the reminder to popup.
4. Doubleclick the only calendar and and change its color (I chose a dark purple one). Save & close the calendar properties dialog with OK.

Actual result: Calendar color changed, reminder popup disappears, popup with MODIFICATION_FAILED pops up.

Error console shows:
Error: An error occurred when writing to the calendar test! Error code: MODIFICATION_FAILED. Description: 
Source File: resource://calendar/modules/calUtils.jsm -> file:///C:/Dokumente%20und%20Einstellungen/Sebastian/Anwendungsdaten/Thunderbird/Profiles/n7i1is1s.Lg-Test/extensions/%7Be2fda1a4-762b-4020-b5ad-a41df1933103%7D/calendar-js/calCalendarManager.js
Line: 1061

Related to bug 533654?
